summary.text:
**Clarifying JSON requirements**

I need to produce JSON with specific sections: summary_md of 200 words or less, a one-line summary under 100 characters, highlights of 3-7 points, and 1-3 next questions. Now, I'm a bit confused because the developer mentioned including citations, but the required structure doesn't have a spot for that. I remember the initial instructions clearly stated to include citations. So, I'm realizing there's a mismatch between the guidelines and the schema I’m working with.

**Creating summary and JSON**

I need to craft a summary_md that’s between 120-160 words. It should include citations like "papers/paper1.txt" and "proofs.md". The dataset has these files, and I'll use two citations as part of the output. For highlights, I need to choose 5 concise items. The next questions should be three in total, asking for further characterization of UPA SCCs, a polynomial-time checker implementation, and empirical testing of pipeline/BR-path lengths.

I'll also make sure that the one-line summary is under 100 characters. Let's keep everything clear and concise!

content.text: {"summary_md":"Round summary: Established graph-level and modular guarantees for PNE in binary SNC games. Main graph-level result: a dependency digraph guarantees a PNE for every W (supported on the digraph) and every h iff the digraph is acyclic (DAG) — backward induction gives existence and a BR-path; any directed cycle can be signed to obstruct uniform existence. Modular construction: SCC composition — if every SCC is universally PNE-admitting (UPA) under arbitrary external fields (examples: undirected SCCs, structurally balanced SCCs after a gauge, functional-cycle SCCs with positive cycle-sign), then assembling PNEs from sinks upward gives a global PNE and BR-path. Added diagnostics and constructive modules: two-node digon test, functional-digraph cycle-sign test, multi-core cohesive existence, monotone bounded-length BR paths, forest corollary, signed row-sum PNE certificate, and dominant-negative-cycle nonexistence certificate. Citations: papers/paper1.txt; proofs.md.","one_line_summary":"DAGs ⇔ uniform PNE; SCC/gauge composition and UPA tests give constructive PNE","highlights":["Uniform guarantee: dependency digraph guarantees PNE for all W,h iff it is a DAG (backward induction).","SCC composition: if every SCC is UPA (e.g., undirected or structurally balanced via gauge) then a global PNE exists; BR-path constructed by reverse SCC order.","UPA tests added: 2-node digon UPA ⇔ W12·W21≥0; functional-digraph SCCs UPA ⇔ every directed cycle has positive sign product.","Constructive sufficient conditions: cohesive-core inequalities (w_R+τ·h ≥ w_S) and weight-dominance |h_i|>∑_j|W_ij| yield consensus/polarized or strict PNE.","Algorithmic pipeline (draft): DAG check → SCC-decompose → per-SCC gauge/symmetry/functional tests → assemble PNE or apply cohesive-core diagnostics."],"next_questions":["Characterize UPA SCCs beyond undirected/structurally-balanced/functional classes (complete structural criterion).","Implement a polynomial-time checker and PNE-constructor following the SCC/gauge/cohesive pipeline and validate on example families.","Evaluate tightness/necessity of cohesive-core and indecomposability bounds; produce minimal counterexamples when they fail."]}

one_line_summary.description: Brief one-line summary for UI display
one_line_summary.title: One Line Summary
